verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:1
verses.text: The Epistle of Ignatius to the Philadelphians Shorter and Longer Versions  Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church of God the Father, and our Lord Jesus Christ, which is at Philadelphia, in Asia, which has obtained mercy, and is established in the harmony of God, and rejoiceth unceasingly in the passion of our Lord, and is filled with all mercy through his resurrection; which I salute in the blood of Jesus Christ, who is our eternal and enduring joy, especially if men are in unity with the bishop, the presbyters, and the deacons, who have been appointed according to the mind of Jesus Christ, whom He has established in security, after His own will, and by His Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:2
verses.text: Ignatius, who is also called Theophorus, to the Church of God the Father, and of the Lord Jesus Christ, which is at Philadelphia, which has obtained mercy through love, and is established in the harmony of God, and rejoiceth unceasingly, in the passion of our Lord Jesus, and is filled with all mercy through His resurrection; which I salute in the blood of Jesus Christ, who is our eternal and enduring joy, especially to those who are in unity with the bishop, and the presbyters, and the deacons, who have been appointed by the will of God the Father, through the Lord Jesus Christ, who, according to His own will, has firmly established His Church upon a rock, by a spiritual building, not made with hands, against which the winds and the floods have beaten, yet have not been able to overthrow it: yea, and may spiritual wickedness never be able to do so, but be thoroughly weakened by the power of Jesus Christ our Lord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:3
verses.text: Which bishop, I know, obtained the ministry which pertains to the common weal, not of himself, neither by men, nor through vainglory, but by the love of God the Father, and the Lord Jesus Christ; at whose meekness I am struck with admiration, and who by his silence is able to accomplish more than those who vainly talk.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:4
verses.text: For he is in harmony with the commandments of God, even as the harp is with its strings.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:5
verses.text: Wherefore my soul declares his mind towards God a happy one, knowing it to be virtuous and perfect, and that his stability as well as freedom from all anger is after the example of the infinite meekness of the living God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:6
verses.text: Having beheld your bishop, I know that he was not selected to undertake the ministry which pertains to the common weal, either by himself or by men, or out of vainglory, but by the love of Jesus Christ, and of God the Father, who raised Him from the dead; at whose meekness I am struck with admiration, and who by His silence is able to accomplish more than they who talk a great deal.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:7
verses.text: For he is in harmony with the commandments and ordinances of the Lord, even as the strings are with the harp, and is no less blameless than was Zacharias the priest.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 1:8
verses.text: Wherefore my soul declares his mind towards God a happy one, knowing it to be virtuous and perfect, and that his stability as well as freedom from all anger is after the example of the infinite meekness of the living God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:1
verses.text: Chapter 2 — Maintain union with the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:2
verses.text: Wherefore, as children of light and truth, flee from division and wicked doctrines; but where the shepherd is, there do ye as sheep follow.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:3
verses.text: For there are many wolves that appear worthy of credit, who, by means of a pernicious pleasure, carry captive those that are running towards God; but in your unity they shall have no place.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:4
verses.text: Wherefore, as children of light and truth, avoid the dividing of your unity, and the wicked doctrine of the heretics, from whom "a defiling influence has gone forth into all the earth".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:5
verses.text: But where the shepherd is, there do ye as sheep follow.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 2:6
verses.text: For there are many wolves in sheep's clothing, who, by means of a pernicious pleasure, carry captive those that are running towards God; but in your unity they shall have no place.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:1
verses.text: Chapter 3 — Avoid schismatics.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:2
verses.text: Keep yourselves from those evil plants which Jesus Christ does not tend, because they are not the planting of the Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:3
verses.text: Not that I have found any division among you, but exceeding purity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:4
verses.text: For as many as are of God and of Jesus Christ are also with the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:5
verses.text: And as many as shall, in the exercise of repentance, return into the unity of the Church, these, too, shall belong to God, that they may live according to Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:6
verses.text: Do not err, my brethren.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:7
verses.text: If any man follows him that makes a schism in the Church, he shall not inherit the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:8
verses.text: If any one walks according to a strange opinion, he agrees not with the passion of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:9
verses.text: Keep yourselves, then, from those evil plants which Jesus Christ does not tend, but that wild beast, the destroyer of men, because they are not the planting of the Father, but the seed of the wicked one.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:10
verses.text: Not that I have found any division among you do I write these things; but I arm you beforehand, as the children of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:11
verses.text: For as many as are of Christ are also with the bishop; but as many as fall away from him, and embrace communion with the accursed, these shall be cut off along with them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:12
verses.text: For they are not Christ's husbandry, but the seed of the enemy, from whom may you ever be delivered by the prayers of the shepherd, that most faithful and gentle shepherd who presides over you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:13
verses.text: I therefore exhort you in the Lord to receive with all tenderness those that repent and return to the unity of the Church, that through your kindness and forbearance they may recover themselves out of the snare of the devil, and becoming worthy of Jesus Christ, may obtain eternal salvation in the kingdom of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:14
verses.text: Brethren, be not deceived.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:15
verses.text: If any man follows him that separates from the truth, he shall not inherit the kingdom of God; and if any man does not stand aloof from the preacher of falsehood, he shall be condemned to hell.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:16
verses.text: For it is obligatory neither to separate from the godly, nor to associate with the ungodly.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:17
verses.text: If any one walks according to a strange opinion, he is not of Christ, nor a partaker of His passion; but is a fox, a destroyer of the vineyard of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:18
verses.text: Have no fellowship with such a man, lest ye perish along with him, even should he be thy father, thy son, thy brother, or a member of thy family.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:19
verses.text: For says the Scripture, "Thine eye shall not spare him".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:20
verses.text: You ought therefore to "hate those that hate God, and to waste away with grief on account of His enemies".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:21
verses.text: I do not mean that you should beat them or persecute them, as do the Gentiles "that know not the Lord and God;" but that you should regard them as your enemies, and separate yourselves from them, while yet you admonish them, and exhort them to repentance, if it may be they will hear, if it may be they will submit themselves.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:22
verses.text: For our God is a lover of mankind, and "will have all men to be saved, and to come to the knowledge of the truth".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 3:23
verses.text: Wherefore "He makes His sun to rise upon the evil and on the good, and sendeth rain on the just and on the unjust;" of whose kindness the Lord, wishing us also to be imitators, says, "Be ye perfect, even as also your Father that is in heaven is perfect".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:1
verses.text: Chapter 4 — Have but one Eucharist, etc.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:2
verses.text: Take ye heed, then, to have but one Eucharist.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:3
verses.text: For there is one flesh of our Lord Jesus Christ, and one cup to show forth the unity of His blood; one altar; as there is one bishop, along with the presbytery and deacons, my fellow-servants: that so, whatsoever ye do, ye may do it according to the will of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:4
verses.text: I have confidence of you in the Lord, that ye will be of no other mind.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:5
verses.text: Wherefore I write boldly to your love, which is worthy of God, and exhort you to have but one faith, and one kind of preaching, and one Eucharist.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:6
verses.text: For there is one flesh of the Lord Jesus Christ; and His blood which was shed for us is one; one loaf also is broken to all the communicants, and one cup is distributed among them all: there is but one altar for the whole Church, and one bishop, with the presbytery and deacons, my fellow-servants.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:7
verses.text: Since, also, there is but one unbegotten Being, God, even the Father; and one only-begotten Son, God, the Word and man; and one Comforter, the Spirit of truth; and also one preaching, and one faith, and one baptism; and one Church which the holy apostles established from one end of the earth to the other by the blood of Christ, and by their own sweat and toil; it behoves you also, therefore, as "a peculiar people, and a holy nation," to perform all things with harmony in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:8
verses.text: Wives, be ye subject to your husbands in the fear of God; and ye virgins, to Christ in purity, not counting marriage an abomination, but desiring that which is better, not for the reproach of wedlock, but for the sake of meditating on the law.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:9
verses.text: Children, obey your parents, and have an affection for them, as workers together with God for your birth into the world.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:10
verses.text: Servants, be subject to your masters in God, that ye may be the freed-men of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:11
verses.text: Husbands, love your wives, as fellow-servants of God, as your own body, as the partners of your life, and your co-adjutors in the procreation of children.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:12
verses.text: Virgins, have Christ alone before your eyes, and His Father in your prayers, being enlightened by the Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:13
verses.text: May I have pleasure in your purity, as that of Elijah, or as of Joshua the son of Nun, as of Melchizedek, or as of Elisha, as of Jeremiah, or as of John the Baptist, as of the beloved disciple, as of Timothy, as of Titus, as of Evodius, as of Clement, who departed this life in perfect chastity, Not, however, that I blame the other blessed saints because they entered into the married state, of which I have just spoken.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:14
verses.text: For I pray that, being found worthy of God, I may be found at their feet in the kingdom, as at the feet of Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob; as of Joseph, and Isaiah, and the rest of the prophets; as of Peter, and Paul, and the rest of the apostles, that were married men.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:15
verses.text: For they entered into these marriages not for the sake of appetite, but out of regard for the propagation of mankind.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:16
verses.text: Fathers, "bring up your children in the nurture and admonition of the Lord;" and teach them the holy Scriptures, and also trades, that they may not indulge in idleness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:17
verses.text: Now the Scripture says, "A righteous father educates his children well; his heart shall rejoice in a wise son".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:18
verses.text: Masters, be gentle towards your servants, as holy Job has taught you; for there is one nature, and one family of mankind.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:19
verses.text: For "in Christ there is neither bond nor free".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:20
verses.text: Let governors be obedient to Caesar; soldiers to those that command them; deacons to the presbyters, as to high-priests; the presbyters, and deacons, and the rest of the clergy, together with all the people, and the soldiers, and the governors, and Caesar himself, to the bishop; the bishop to Christ, even as Christ to the Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:21
verses.text: And thus unity is preserved throughout.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:22
verses.text: Let not the widows be wanderers about, nor fond of dainties, nor gadders from house to house; but let them be like Judith, noted for her seriousness; and like Anna, eminent for her sobriety.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 4:23
verses.text: I do not ordain these things as an apostle: for "who am I, or what is my father's house," that I should pretend to be equal in honour to them? But as your "fellow-soldier," I hold the position of one who simply admonishes you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:1
verses.text: Chapter 5 — Pray for me.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:2
verses.text: My brethren, I am greatly enlarged in loving you; and rejoicing exceedingly over you, I seek to secure your safety.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:3
verses.text: Yet it is not I, but Jesus Christ, for whose sake being bound I fear the more, inasmuch as I am not yet perfect.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:4
verses.text: But your prayer to God shall make me perfect, that I may attain to that portion which through mercy has been allotted me, while I flee to the Gospel as to the flesh of Jesus, and to the apostles as to the presbytery of the Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:5
verses.text: And let us also love the prophets, because they too have proclaimed the Gospel, and placed their hope in Him, and waited for Him; in whom also believing, they were saved, through union to Jesus Christ, being holy men, worthy of love and admiration, having had witness borne to them by Jesus Christ, and being reckoned along with us in the Gospel of the common hope.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:6
verses.text: My brethren, I am greatly enlarged in loving you; and rejoicing exceedingly over you, I seek to secure your safety.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:7
verses.text: Yet it is not I, but the Lord Jesus through me; for whose sake being bound, I fear the more, for I am not yet perfect.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:8
verses.text: But your prayer to God shall make me perfect, that I may attain that to which I have been called, while I flee to the Gospel as to the flesh of Jesus Christ, and to the apostles as the presbytery of the Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:9
verses.text: I do also love the prophets as those who announced Christ, and as being partakers of the same Spirit with the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:10
verses.text: For as the false prophets and the false apostles drew to themselves one and the same wicked, deceitful, and seducing spirit; so also did the prophets and the apostles receive from God, through Jesus Christ, one and the same Holy Spirit, who is good, and sovereign, and true, and the Author of saving knowledge.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:11
verses.text: For there is one God of the Old and New Testament, "one Mediator between God and men," for the creation of both intelligent and sensitive beings, and in order to exercise a beneficial and suitable providence over them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:12
verses.text: There is also one Comforter, who displayed His power in Moses, and the prophets, and apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 5:13
verses.text: All the saints, therefore, were saved by Christ, hoping in Him, and waiting for Him; and they obtained through Him salvation, being holy ones, worthy of love and admiration, having testimony borne to them by Jesus Christ, in the Gospel of our common hope.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:1
verses.text: Chapter 6 — Do not accept Judaism.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:2
verses.text: But if any one preach the Jewish law unto you, listen not to him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:3
verses.text: For it is better to hearken to Christian doctrine from a man who has been circumcised, than to Judaism from one uncircumcised.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:4
verses.text: But if either of such persons do not speak concerning Jesus Christ, they are in my judgment but as monuments and sepulchres of the dead, upon which are written only the names of men.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:5
verses.text: Flee therefore the wicked devices and snares of the prince of this world, lest at any time being conquered by his artifices, ye grow weak in your love.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:6
verses.text: But be ye all joined together with an undivided heart.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:7
verses.text: And I thank my God that I have a good conscience in respect to you, and that no one has it in his power to boast, either privately or publicly, that I have burdened any one either in much or in little.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:8
verses.text: And I wish for all among whom I have spoken, that they may not possess that for a testimony against them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:9
verses.text: If any one preaches the one God of the law and the prophets, but denies Christ to be the Son of God, he is a liar, even as also is his father the devil, and is a Jew falsely so called, being possessed of mere carnal circumcision.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:10
verses.text: If any one confesses Christ Jesus the Lord, but denies the God of the law and of the prophets, saying that the Father of Christ is not the Maker of heaven and earth, he has not continued in the truth any more than his father the devil, and is a disciple of Simon Magus, not of the Holy Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:11
verses.text: If any one says there is one God, and also confesses Christ Jesus, but thinks the Lord to be a mere man, and not the only-begotten God, and Wisdom, and the Word of God, and deems Him to consist merely of a soul and body, such an one is a serpent, that preaches deceit and error for the destruction of men.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:12
verses.text: And such a man is poor in understanding, even as by name he is an Ebionite.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:13
verses.text: If any one confesses the truths mentioned, but calls lawful wedlock, and the procreation of children, destruction and pollution, or deems certain kinds of food abominable, such an one has the apostate dragon dwelling within him.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:14
verses.text: If any one confesses the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Ghost, and praises the creation, but calls the incarnation merely an appearance, and is ashamed of the passion, such an one has denied the faith, not less than the Jews who killed Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:15
verses.text: If any one confesses these things, and that God the Word did dwell in a human body, being within it as the Word, even as the soul also is in the body, because it was God that inhabited it, and not a human soul, but affirms that unlawful unions are a good thing, and places the highest happiness in pleasure, as does the man who is falsely called a Nicolaitan, this person can neither be a lover of God, nor a lover of Christ, but is a corrupter of his own flesh, and therefore void of the Holy Spirit, and a stranger to Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:16
verses.text: All such persons are but monuments and sepulchres of the dead, upon which are written only the names of dead men.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:17
verses.text: Flee, therefore, the wicked devices and snares of the spirit which now worketh in the children of this world, lest at any time being overcome, ye grow weak in your love.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:18
verses.text: But be ye all joined together with an undivided heart and a willing mind, "being of one accord and of one judgment," being always of the same opinion about the same things, both when you are at ease and in danger, both in sorrow and in joy.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:19
verses.text: I thank God, through Jesus Christ, that I have a good conscience in respect to you, and that no one has it in his power to boast, either privately or publicly, that I have burdened any one either in much or in little.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 6:20
verses.text: And I wish for all among whom I have spoken, that they may not possess that for a testimony against them.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:1
verses.text: Chapter 7 — I have exhorted you to unity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:2
verses.text: For though some would have deceived me according to the flesh, yet the Spirit, as being from God, is not deceived.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:3
verses.text: For it knows both whence it comes and whither it goes, and detects the secrets of the heart.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:4
verses.text: For, when I was among you, I cried, I spoke with a loud voice: Give heed to the bishop, and to the presbytery and deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:5
verses.text: Now, some suspected me of having spoken thus, as knowing beforehand the division caused by some among you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:6
verses.text: But He is my witness, for whose sake I am in bonds, that I got no intelligence from any man.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:7
verses.text: But the Spirit proclaimed these words: Do nothing without the bishop; keep your bodies as the temples of God; love unity; avoid divisions; be the followers of Jesus Christ, even as He is of His Father.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:8
verses.text: For though some would have deceived me according to the flesh, yet my spirit is not deceived; for I have received it from God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:9
verses.text: For it knows both whence it comes and whither it goes, and detects the secrets of the heart.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:10
verses.text: For when I was among you, I cried, I spoke with a loud voice—the word is not mine, but God's—Give heed to the bishop, and to the presbytery and deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:11
verses.text: But if ye suspect that I spake thus, as having learned beforehand the division caused by some among you, He is my witness, for whose sake I am in bonds, that I learned nothing of it from the mouth of any man.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 7:12
verses.text: But the Spirit made an announcement to me, saying as follows: Do nothing without the bishop; keep your bodies as the temples of God; love unity; avoid divisions; be ye followers of Paul, and of the rest of the apostles, even as they also were of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:1
verses.text: Chapter 8 — The same continued.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:2
verses.text: I therefore did what belonged to me, as a man devoted to unity.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:3
verses.text: For where there is division and wrath, God doth not dwell.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:4
verses.text: To all them that repent, the Lord grants forgiveness, if they turn in penitence to the unity of God, and to communion with the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:5
verses.text: I trust as to you in the grace of Jesus Christ, who shall free you from every bond.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:6
verses.text: And I exhort you to do nothing out of strife, but according to the doctrine of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:7
verses.text: When I heard some saying, If I do not find it in the ancient Scriptures, I will not believe the Gospel; on my saying to them, It is written, they answered me, That remains to be proved.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:8
verses.text: But to me Jesus Christ is in the place of all that is ancient: His cross, and death, and resurrection, and the faith which is by Him, are undefiled monuments of antiquity; by which I desire, through your prayers, to be justified.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:9
verses.text: I therefore did what belonged to me, as a man devoted to unity; adding this also, that where there is diversity of judgment, and wrath, and hatred, God does not dwell.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:10
verses.text: To all them that repent, God grants forgiveness, if they with one consent return to the unity of Christ, and communion with the bishop.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:11
verses.text: I trust to the grace of Jesus Christ, that He will free you from every bond of wickedness.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:12
verses.text: I therefore exhort you that ye do nothing out of strife, but according to the doctrine of Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:13
verses.text: For I have heard some saying, If I do not find the Gospel in the archives, I will not believe it.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:14
verses.text: To such persons I say that my archives are Jesus Christ, to disobey whom is manifest destruction.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:15
verses.text: My authentic archives are His cross, and death, and resurrection, and the faith which bears on these things, by which I desire, through your prayers, to be justified.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:16
verses.text: He who disbelieves the Gospel disbelieves everything along with it.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:17
verses.text: For the archives ought not to be preferred to the Spirit.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 8:18
verses.text: "It is hard to kick against the pricks;" it is hard to disbelieve Christ; it is hard to reject the preaching of the apostles.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:1
verses.text: Chapter 9 — The Old Testament is good: the New Testament is better.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:2
verses.text: The priests indeed are good, but the High Priest is better; to whom the holy of holies has been committed, and who alone has been trusted with the secrets of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:3
verses.text: He is the door of the Father, by which enter in Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, and the prophets, and the apostles, and the Church.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:4
verses.text: All these have for their object the attaining to the unity of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:5
verses.text: But the Gospel possesses something transcendent above the former dispensation, viz.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:6
verses.text: , the appearance of our Lord Jesus Christ, His passion and resurrection.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:7
verses.text: For the beloved prophets announced Him, but the Gospel is the perfection of immortality.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:8
verses.text: All these things are good together, if ye believe in love.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:9
verses.text: The priests indeed, and the ministers of the word, are good; but the High Priest is better, to whom the holy of holies has been committed, and who alone has been entrusted with the secrets of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:10
verses.text: The ministering powers of God are good.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:11
verses.text: The Comforter is holy, and the Word is holy, the Son of the Father, by whom He made all things, and exercises a providence over them all.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:12
verses.text: This is the Way which leads to the Father, the Rock, the Defence, the Key, the Shepherd, the Sacrifice, the Door of knowledge, through which have entered Abraham, and Isaac, and Jacob, Moses and all the company of the prophets, and these pillars of the world, the apostles, and the spouse of Christ, on whose account He poured out His own blood, as her marriage portion, that He might redeem her.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:13
verses.text: All these things tend towards the unity of the one and only true God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:14
verses.text: But the Gospel possesses something transcendent above the former dispensation, viz.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:15
verses.text: the appearing of our Saviour Jesus Christ, His passion, and the resurrection itself.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:16
verses.text: For those things which the prophets announced, saying, "Until He come for whom it is reserved, and He shall be the expectation of the Gentiles," have been fulfilled in the Gospel, our Lord saying, "Go ye and teach all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father, and of the Son, and of the Holy Ghost".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 9:17
verses.text: All then are good together, the law, the prophets, the apostles, the whole company of others that have believed through them: only if we love one another.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:1
verses.text: Chapter 10 — Congratulate the inhabitants of Antioch on the close of the persecution.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:2
verses.text: Since, according to your prayers, and the compassion which ye feel in Christ Jesus, it is reported to me that the Church which is at Antioch in Syria possesses peace, it will become you, as a Church of God, to elect a deacon to act as the ambassador of God for you to the brethren there, that he may rejoice along with them when they are met together, and glorify the name of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:3
verses.text: Blessed is he in Jesus Christ, who shall be deemed worthy of such a ministry; and ye too shall be glorified.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:4
verses.text: And if ye are willing, it is not beyond your power to do this, for the sake of God; as also the nearest Churches have sent, in some cases bishops, and in others presbyters and deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:5
verses.text: Since, according to your prayers, and the compassion which ye feel in Christ Jesus, it is reported to me that the Church which is at Antioch in Syria possesses peace, it will become you, as a Church of God, to elect a bishop to act as the ambassador of God for you to the brethren there, that it may be granted them to meet together, and to glorify the name of God.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:6
verses.text: Blessed is he in Christ Jesus, who shall be deemed worthy of such a ministry; and if ye be zealous in this matter, ye shall receive glory in Christ.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 10:7
verses.text: And if ye are willing, it is not altogether beyond your power to do this, for the sake of God; as also the nearest Churches have sent, in some cases bishops, and in others presbyters and deacons.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:1
verses.text: Chapter 11 — Thanks and salutation.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:2
verses.text: Now, as to Philo the deacon, of Cilicia, a man of reputation, who still ministers to me in the word of God, along with Rheus Agathopus, an elect man, who has followed me from Syria, not regarding his life,—these bear witness in your behalf; and I myself give thanks to God for you, that ye have received them, even as the Lord you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:3
verses.text: But may those that dishonoured them be forgiven through the grace of Jesus Christ! The love of the brethren at Troas salutes you; whence also I write to you by Burrhus, who was sent along with me by the Ephesians and Smyrnaeans, to show their respect.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:4
verses.text: May the Lord Jesus Christ honour them, in whom they hope, in flesh, and soul, and faith, and love, and concord! Fare ye well in Christ Jesus, our common hope.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:5
verses.text: Now, as to Philo the deacon, a man of Cilicia, of high reputation, who still ministers to me in the word of God, along with Gaius and Agathopus, an elect man, who has followed me from Syria, not regarding his life,—these also bear testimony in your behalf.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:6
verses.text: And I myself give thanks to God for you, because ye have received them: and the Lord will also receive you.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:7
verses.text: But may those that dishonoured them be forgiven through the grace of Jesus Christ, "who wisheth not the death of the sinner, but his repentance".

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:8
verses.text: The love of the brethren at Troas salutes you; whence also I write to you by Burrhus, who was sent along with me by the Ephesians and Smyrnaeans, to show their respect: whom the Lord Jesus Christ will requite, in whom they hope, in flesh, and soul, and spirit, and faith, and love, and concord.

verses.name: Ignatius: Epistle to Philadelphians 11:9
verses.text: Fare ye well in the Lord Jesus Christ, our common hope, in the Holy Ghost.
